<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 856, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 213, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 698]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 714]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 92, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 836, 102]]<|/det|>
A curve passes through the point with coordinates \(\left(\frac{1}{2}\pi , 5\right)\) and is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 4\sec^2\left(\frac{1}{2}x\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 111, 358, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 85, 631, 265]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 275, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curves \(y = \mathrm{e}^{2x}\) and \(y = 8\mathrm{e}^{- x}\). The shaded region is bounded by the two curves and the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 323, 144, 342]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 323, 771, 344]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of the point of intersection of the two curves is \(\ln 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 325, 918, 344]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 570, 144, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 570, 428, 590]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 571, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 92, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 75, 697, 102]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{4\sin x}{3 + \cos 2x}\) for values of \(x\) such that \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 2\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 123, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 119, 228, 144]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 918, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 312, 141, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 312, 653, 331]]<|/det|>
Hence find the coordinates of the stationary points of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 312, 918, 331]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 350, 915, 368]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 730, 94]]<|/det|>
(a) Sketch on the same diagram the graphs of \(y = \left|2x - 3\right|\) and \(y = \ln (x + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 323, 866, 344]]<|/det|>
The \(x\)-coordinates of the points where the graphs intersect are denoted by \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\), where \(\alpha < \beta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 355, 144, 373]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 354, 425, 373]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\alpha = 1.5 - 0.5\ln (\alpha +1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 355, 920, 373]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 477, 144, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 477, 918, 512]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part **(b)**, to find the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 710, 146, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 710, 514, 728]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that \(2.055 < \beta < 2.065\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 710, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 144, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 794, 96]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(18x^{3} - 6x^{2} - 30x + 4\) is divided by \((3x - 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 288, 185, 307]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 285, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\int_{1}^{5} \frac{18x^{3} - 6x^{2} - 30x + 4}{3x - 1} \mathrm{~d}x\). Give your answer in the form \(a - \ln b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 316, 918, 335]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Express \(6\sin \theta - 4\cos \theta\) in the form \(R\sin (\theta - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\). Give the exact value of \(R\) and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 697, 91]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(6\sin \theta - 4\cos \theta +5 = 0\) for \(0^\circ < \theta < 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 72, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 448, 181, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 448, 616, 467]]<|/det|>
As the value of \(\beta\) varies, find the greatest possible value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 475, 601, 496]]<|/det|>
\[(3\sin 4\beta -2\cos 4\beta)^2 +15\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
and determine the smallest positive value of \(\beta\), in degrees, for which this greatest value occurs. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 74, 467, 94]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(3\mathrm{e}^{2x}y + 4\mathrm{e}^{3x} + y^3 = 18.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 116, 146, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 114, 395, 144]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{-2\mathrm{e}^{2x}y - 4\mathrm{e}^{3x}}{\mathrm{e}^{2x} + y^2}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 507, 88]]<|/det|>
Show that the curve has no stationary points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
